= Installation = 
== Maven users ==
Add the following dependency to your pom.xml:

{{{
<dependency>
      <groupId>com.jayway.restassured</groupId>
      <artifactId>rest-assured</artifactId>
      <version>1.7</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
</dependency>
}}}

Note: You should place rest-assured before JUnit in your pom.xml dependency declaration in order to make sure that the correct version of Hamcrest is used. 

== Non-maven users ==
Download [http://rest-assured.googlecode.com/files/rest-assured-1.7.zip REST Assured] and put it in your class-path. You may also need to download the [http://rest-assured.googlecode.com/files/rest-assured-dependencies.zip third-party dependencies] and put them in your classpath as well. 

= Static imports =
       
In order to use REST assured effectively it's recommended to statically import methods from the following classes:

  * `com.jayway.restassured.RestAssured.*`
  * `com.jayway.restassured.matcher.RestAssuredMatchers.*`
  * `org.hamcrest.Matchers.*`

= Documentation =
When you've successfully downloaded and configured REST Assured in your classpath please refer to the [Usage user guide] for examples.
